author: ralexstokes
content: question on the validator guide: according to `process_proposer_slashing` (https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/master/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#proposer-slashings), blocks on conflicting slots are slashable; the validator guide says that this condition is at the epoch level

author: ralexstokes
content: how are others interpreting this? i vaguely remember we went back and forth on per-epoch vs per-slot proposer slashings

author: ralexstokes
content: after a quick scan, there is the tiny chance you could be called to produce a block twice in one epoch -- so then you want per-slot protection, *not* per-epoch protection

author: ralexstokes
content: if the v-guide just needs to be updated then i'm happy to make a PR

author: ralexstokes
content: another question on aggregation: what is my incentive to actually aggregate, rather than just broadcast an `AggregateAndProof` with just my single attestation? bc my committee (which i am a part of) gets rewarded more w/ greater aggregation? (with the other tradeoff being how long the inclusion delay is...)

author: ralexstokes
content: i think i have answered this last question cf. this line: `rewards[index] += get_base_reward(state, index) * attesting_balance // total_balance` from `get_attestation_deltas`

content: and this actually isn't linked to just my beacon committee since we got rid of crosslink rewards -- i can penalize the entire v-set if i don't mind forgoing some rewards myself
